content:
• Thursday, January 31, 2013
  • OCLR

    More on Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR): FQ2 misses the mark on EPS estimates but comes in line on total...

    More on Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR): FQ2 misses the mark on EPS estimates but comes in line on total revenue. The company issues cautious guidance going forward, saying that market and economic conditions remain uncertain in a typically softer March quarter. It now expects Q3 sales of $140.0M - 155.0M, versus analysts estimates of $153.70M. Shares -6.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM
  • BEBE

    More on bebe stores (OTC:BEBE): FQ2 beats on the top line but comes up short on a per share...

    More on bebe stores (OTC:BEBE): FQ2 beats on the top line but comes up short on a per share basis, as the retailer posts bigger losses on lower comp store sales and tighter margins. Net sales decreased by 10.9%, and gross margin as a percentage of net sales decreased to 33.9%, compared to 40.1% in the prior year. The decrease was primarily due to higher markdowns coupled with unfavorable occupancy leverage. Shares -4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM
  • ECTE

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE) announces a secondary offering, but no details of the size or terms...

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE) announces a secondary offering, but no details of the size or terms were given. Aegis Capital is acting as the sole book-running manager for the offering. Shares -7.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • CMPR

    More on VistaPrint (VPRT): FQ2 easily beats across the board on a double-digit gain in total...

    More on VistaPrint (VPRT): FQ2 easily beats across the board on a double-digit gain in total revenue. Net income grew by 14% Y/Y due largely to seasonal strength of its holiday-related business in Europe. Gross margin also grew to 67.2% from 66.8%. The company ups EPS guidance for FY 2013, now expecting an EPS of $1.79 to $1.99 per share. The Street view is for earnings of $1.74 per share. However, revenue is expected to be on the low end of estimates. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • ADNC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ADNC +26%. TSYS +13%. PMCS +7%. N +7%. ABAX +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ADNC +26%. TSYS +13%. PMCS +7%. N +7%. ABAX +5%.
    After-hours top losers: CPSI -9%. OPLK -6%. OTC:BEBE -4%. ELX -4%. LTM-OLD -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • BB

    A rash of negative commentary helped BlackBerry (RIMM -6.4%) close with big losses again; shares...

    A rash of negative commentary helped BlackBerry (RIMM -6.4%) close with big losses again; shares are now down 26% on the week. Evercore joined Credit Suisse in downgrading BlackBerry, citing steep unsubsidized pricing and limited initial availability for the Z10, and a lack of timing details about the QWERTY-featuring Q10. Canaccord and MKM are also downbeat on BB10's prospects, and shots have been fired at the Z10's low-light camera performance and (Bing-powered) mapping software. Goldman, which upgraded in November, is staying positive.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 20 Comments
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP): Q4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.1. Revenue of $177M (+19% Y/Y) beats by...

    Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP): Q4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.1. Revenue of $177M (+19% Y/Y) beats by $3.29M. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • ABAX

    Abaxis (NASDAQ:ABAX): FQ3 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $49.8M (+32% Y/Y) beats by...

    Abaxis (NASDAQ:ABAX): FQ3 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $49.8M (+32% Y/Y) beats by $4.05M. Shares +6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • CPSI

    Computer Programs & Systems (NASDAQ:CPSI): Q4 EPS of $0.83 misses by $0.04. Revenue of...

    Computer Programs & Systems (NASDAQ:CPSI): Q4 EPS of $0.83 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $47.9M misses by $4.07M. Shares -8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • GPT

    Gramercy Capital (GKK) gets a monkey off its back, announcing the sale of the collateral...

    Gramercy Capital (GKK) gets a monkey off its back, announcing the sale of the collateral management agreements on its 3 CDOs for $9.9M (plus another $14M in 6-9 months), and the intention to liquidate its CDO bond portfolio for about $32M in the next 30-90 days. The moves unlock more than $50M of liquidity currently tied up in the CDO business. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • ADNC

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Audience (ADNC - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $43M-$46M and EPS of...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Audience (ADNC - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $43M-$46M and EPS of $0.08-$0.12, way above a consensus of $31.8M and $0.01. 2) Emulex (ELX - earnings) expects FQ3 revenue of $110M-$114M and EPS of $0.12-$0.14, below a consensus of $117.5M and $0.16. 3) Brightcove (BCOV - earnings) expects 2013 revenue of $102M-$105M and EPS of -$0.18 to -$0.25, below a consensus of $106.2M and -$0.15. ADNC +30.8% AH. ELX -4.1%. BCOV -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • N

    More on NetSuite: Deferred revenue balance jumped 19% Q/Q and 44% Y/Y in Q4 to $161.4M....

    More on NetSuite: Deferred revenue balance jumped 19% Q/Q and 44% Y/Y in Q4 to $161.4M. Subscription/support revenue +26% Y/Y to $68.5M, services/other +67% to $16.5M. Operating cash flow +15% to $13.4M. Opex +29%, less than billings growth. CEO Zach Nelson trash-talks Microsoft, accusing them of failing to "deliver cloud-native ERP solutions." N +9.8% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast), guidance should be provided. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • ELX

    Emulex (NYSE:ELX): FQ2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $122.2M (-5% Y/Y) beats by...

    Emulex (NYSE:ELX): FQ2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $122.2M (-5% Y/Y) beats by $0.34M. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • MCK

    More on McKesson (NYSE:MCK): FQ3 misses on the bottom line while beating total sales estimates,...

    More on McKesson (NYSE:MCK): FQ3 misses on the bottom line while beating total sales estimates, driven by higher medical-surgical distribution and services revenues. For FY13, EPS estimates are guided lower, now expected to be between $7.15 - 7.35 to $7.10 - 7.30 per share. Street estimates are for an EPS of $7.30. The company also says it's board has authorized an additional $500M to its stock buyback program. Shares -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • BCOV

    Brightcove (NASDAQ:BCOV): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $24.3M (+31% Y/Y) beats by...

    Brightcove (NASDAQ:BCOV): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $24.3M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $1.15M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium Networks (CAVM): Q4 EPS of $0.2 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $66.4M beats by $0.31M. Shares...

    Cavium Networks (CAVM): Q4 EPS of $0.2 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $66.4M beats by $0.31M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT): Q4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.1. Non-Gaap Revenue of $138.6M (+13% Y/Y)...

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT): Q4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.1. Non-Gaap Revenue of $138.6M (+13% Y/Y) misses by $4.02M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • PWER

    Power-One (NASDAQ:PWER): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $191.7M (-28% Y/Y) misses...

    Power-One (NASDAQ:PWER): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $191.7M (-28% Y/Y) misses by $6.5M, but in-line with lowered guidance. Expects Q1 revenue of $175M-$200M vs. $194.7M consensus. Sees Q/Q improvement in gross margin. Shares -2.7% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • BCR

    C.R. Bard (NYSE:BCR): Q4 EPS of $1.7 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $762.6M (+1% Y/Y) beats by $....

    C.R. Bard (NYSE:BCR): Q4 EPS of $1.7 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $762.6M (+1% Y/Y) beats by $. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • FIRE

    Strong earnings from Citrix, Fortinet, and SGI have translated into solid gains for a number of...

    Strong earnings from Citrix, Fortinet, and SGI have translated into solid gains for a number of enterprise IT stocks. Winners include security hardware firms Sourcefire (FIRE +4.9%), Palo Alto Networks (PANW +2.8%), and Check Point (CHKP +3%), and server adapter card/interconnect switch makers Mellanox (MLNX +6.2%) and Emulex (ELX +2.6%), WAN optimization leader Riverbed (RVBD +1.7%), and Citrix virtualization/cloud management rival Red Hat (RHT +2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CSII

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +15%) gains today after reporting a better-than-expected Q2 net...

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +15%) gains today after reporting a better-than-expected Q2 net loss of $0.28 per share, $0.05 wider than a year ago but nonetheless beating analyst expectations. Revenue climbed 28% Y/Y, as conversions to the company's Stealth 360 treatment for peripheral artery disease continued at a high rate, representing 93% of total device revenues for the quarter. Revenue from office-based labs also climbed at a double-digit pace.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • CLSN

    Roth Capital is stepping to the sidelines on Celsion (CLSN -81%), cutting the shares to Neutral...

    Roth Capital is stepping to the sidelines on Celsion (CLSN -81%), cutting the shares to Neutral on the back of the failed trial results on its experimental liver cancer drug ThermoDox. The technology failed to significantly slow the progression of liver cancer by what appears to be a wide marging, and calls into doubt the drug's near-term viability.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIOF

    Biofuel Energy (BIOF +15.1%) and Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +12.4%) are among biofuel and ethanol...

    Biofuel Energy (BIOF +15.1%) and Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +12.4%) are among biofuel and ethanol stocks surging as the EPA raises standards for biomass-based diesel, advanced biofuels, cellulosic biofuels and total renewable fuels. Also: REGI +5.7%, GPRE +2.7%, AMRS +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • GOLD

    The threat of resource nationalism shifts to Barrick Gold (ABX -1.2%) and Goldcorp (GG -1.6%),...

    The threat of resource nationalism shifts to Barrick Gold (ABX -1.2%) and Goldcorp (GG -1.6%), as the Dominican Republic’s congress says it wants a more favorable contract on the Pueblo Viejo mine, which reached commercial production two weeks ago. If the tax rate was raised to 35% and the net smelter royalty to 5%, NAV assumptions for each company could drop $0.40-$0.50/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 5 Comments
  • EA

    Though FQ3 sales and FQ4 guidance fell short of estimates, Electronic Arts (EA +4.5%) is having...

    Though FQ3 sales and FQ4 guidance fell short of estimates, Electronic Arts (EA +4.5%) is having a good day. Low expectations following a torrent of negative industry data are helping, and so might decent numbers for some digital offerings. Battlefield 3 Premium subs rose by 900K Q/Q to 2.9M, FIFA 13 digital revenue topped $100M, The Simpsons: Tapped Out was the quarter's top-grossing iOS game ($23M), Origin's registered base rose by 9M to 39M (17M mobile), and total mobile sales rose 19% to $99M. Console revenue fell 28%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • CNX

    Despite weak coal markets last year, Consol Energy (CNX +1.9%) says it developed six new thermal...

    Despite weak coal markets last year, Consol Energy (CNX +1.9%) says it developed six new thermal domestic and export customers and made coal deliveries to new facilities in China, India and Dominican Republic. CEO Brett Harvey expects to continue to sell assets in 2013, but not at fire sale prices; 2012 sales involved "assets that people wanted [and] were willing to pay a good price." (Q4 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • AGO

    A check in on Assured Guarantee (AGO +1.6%) finds the stock up nearly every single day since...

    A check in on Assured Guarantee (AGO +1.6%) finds the stock up nearly every single day since Moody's downgraded the company on Jan. 18. The downgrade was a mistake, says Wilbur Ross, incredulous Moody's never asked him - the company's largest shareholder and a board member - about its claim shareholders were putting pressure on the company to make bad decisions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • HGG

    hhgregg (HGG +10.6%) will continue to shift its focus away from electronics and video to home...

    hhgregg (HGG +10.6%) will continue to shift its focus away from electronics and video to home appliances and products as it hopes to bring significant profitability back into the picture. The retailer's turnaround probably won't be the quickest in history. For FY13, it  forecasts comparable store sales will fall between 8.5% to 7.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUXL

    Auxilium (AUXL +4.6%) trades up today after it closes on a $350M offering of 150% convertible...

    Auxilium (AUXL +4.6%) trades up today after it closes on a $350M offering of 150% convertible senior notes maturing in 2018, including $25.0 million of notes issued to underwriters to cover overallotments. The company intends to use the proceeds to fund potential acquisitions, as well as for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • PBR

    Problems caused by fuel subsidies, project delays and soaring costs at Petrobras (PBR -2%) are...

    Problems caused by fuel subsidies, project delays and soaring costs at Petrobras (PBR -2%) are spreading to the wider Brazilian economy, undermining PBR's suppliers and raising credit risks. To fight cost overruns, limit rising debt and make up for $8B-plus in refining losses, PBR reportedly is squeezing suppliers and investors by making them wait longer to receive payment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVG

    AVG Technologies (AVG -2.2%) spikes lower after SA contributor Eiad Asbahi states Google is...

    AVG Technologies (AVG -2.2%) spikes lower after SA contributor Eiad Asbahi states Google is planning search toolbar policy changes that will do a number on AVG's toolbar revenue (45% of total). Whereas AVG's toolbar automatically makes AVG search (Google-powered, but featuring AVG ads) a user's default search engine, Asbahi expects a pending change will require users to specifically opt in. Also, pending browser changes will make unintentional toolbar installs harder to come by. He gives the company a valuation of $8.50-$10/share, well below current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT -3.4%) says it's submitted an Investigational New Drug application...

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT -3.4%) says it's submitted an Investigational New Drug application to the FDA to support a proposed indication of GR-MD-02 for treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis with advanced fibrosis, or fatty liver disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • FB

    In spite of a slew of downgrades, Facebook (FB -0.4%) has nearly erased the big losses it...

    In spite of a slew of downgrades, Facebook (FB -0.4%) has nearly erased the big losses it initially saw in response to its Q4 report. Those downgrading are generally worried about Facebook's spending plans and the pace of mobile ad growth as PC activity continues to get cannibalized. Piper says investors were looking for at least $350M in mobile ad sales vs. the $306M reported (ed: doesn't this imply PC sales were better than expected, given Facebook beat revenue estimates?). ZNGA +4.7%. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • LDK

    Cash-strapped LDK Solar (LDK +8.8%) jumps after scoring a $69.8M loan from China Development...

    Cash-strapped LDK Solar (LDK +8.8%) jumps after scoring a $69.8M loan from China Development Bank to finance an upgrade to a polysilicon plant. The news comes a week after LDK announced it's selling a 12.1% stake to peer Funai Investment. Meanwhile, Suntech (STP +4.4%) announces it has completed a 3.5MW Saudi project, and First Solar (FSLR +0.1%) discloses it has bought a 50MW project based in Luna County, NM and set to be finished in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • COP

    Conoco (COP -4.2%) CEO Ryan Lance says the company has no plans to split up its assets, despite...

    Conoco (COP -4.2%) CEO Ryan Lance says the company has no plans to split up its assets, despite the activist trend of calling for separating high-growth U.S. conventional assets from international. COP's asset sales strategy should insulate it from shareholder ire, Raymond James' Pavel Molchanov says: "If [COP] had not spun off Phillips 66 last year, the odds of having an activist come in would be greater."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • CVM

    CEL-SCI (CVM +2.3%) gains after announcing that its longstanding collaboration with Northeast...

    CEL-SCI (CVM +2.3%) gains after announcing that its longstanding collaboration with Northeast Ohio Medical University has produced a new investigational breast cancer vaccine which prevents and treats a HER-2/neu expressing breast cancer tumor in a mouse model of the disease. In addtion to finding an absence of tumors in lymph nodes or peritoneal membranes, the vaccine also demonstrated a reduction in the number of tumors and tumor mass.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • BBY

    More on Best Buy (BBY +1.6%): Shares continue to lift higher as the news of a potential scaling...

    More on Best Buy (BBY +1.6%): Shares continue to lift higher as the news of a potential scaling back in Canada is digested by investors. Confirmed reports of closures in British Columbia, Quebec, Manitoba, and Ontario are already in. Nothing official from the company has been released, although pressures from online pricing and the showrooming effect are being pinned for the action by analysts. Could this be a trial balloon for more U.S. store closures?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • ORCC

    Midday top 10 gainers: ORCC +82%. WMS-OLD +52%. FTNT +24%. HHS +22%. EDMC +18%. BTUI +18%. JDSU...

    Midday top 10 gainers: ORCC +82%. WMS-OLD +52%. FTNT +24%. HHS +22%. EDMC +18%. BTUI +18%. JDSU +18%. PBI +17%. CSII +16%. SGI +16%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: CLSN -81%. LQDT -24%. STZ -20%. NVGN -18%. FIO -16%. HALO -16%. RDEN -14%. USAK -13%. HAR -13%. JBSS -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme (HALO -15.6%) spikes lower again today after Wedbush takes its cue from comments Roche...

    Halozyme (HALO -15.6%) spikes lower again today after Wedbush takes its cue from comments Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) made to cut the shares to Neutral and reduce its price target to $13 from $17. Wedbush no longer thinks the subcutaneous version of Herceptin will get approval this year, which would've triggered a milestone payment to HALO. Additionally, during its call yesterday, Roche noted that it's lessened its perceived importance on the drug, saying it plans on "completely replacing it with our follow on products." Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT -8.3%) adds to yesterday's giant losses after Wells Fargo and Craig-Hallum downgrade...

    Velti (VELT -8.3%) adds to yesterday's giant losses after Wells Fargo and Craig-Hallum downgrade shares in response to the company's analyst day remarks. CFO Jeff Ross' comments lead Wells to think "greater discipline on contract quality and geographical mix will have a significant negative impact on both revenue and EBITDA growth in the near-term" - Velti has already said it will divest assets in markets with very high collection times. The firm also notes formal 2013 guidance wasn't provided.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • NSM

    Nationstar Mortgage (NSM +3.9%) after publishing its road-show presentation guiding 2013...

    Nationstar Mortgage (NSM +3.9%) after publishing its road-show presentation guiding 2013 adjusted EBITDA/share to $9.50-$11.05 and 2014 to $12.30-$14.30. 2013 EPS is expected at $3.70-$4.35, with the "landmark" BofA MSR acquisition adding $0.70-$0.80 to the bottom line. 2014 EPS of $5.60-$6.50, with the BofA deal adding $2.30-$2.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • ALKS

    Shares of Alkermes (ALKS +2.3%) move up today after its FQ3 easily beats bottom line estimates....

    Shares of Alkermes (ALKS +2.3%) move up today after its FQ3 easily beats bottom line estimates. Revenue grew by 8.2% Y/Y, driven by a 33% jump in sales of its five key commercial lines. For FY13, the company raises guidance above Street estimates, now expecting to earn between $0.99 - $1.13 per share. Analysts were expecting an EPS of $0.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm's (QCOM +4.6%) strong FQ1 (I, II) indicates the company is "decoupled from Apple" and...

    Qualcomm's (QCOM +4.6%) strong FQ1 (I, II) indicates the company is "decoupled from Apple" and capable of growing regardless of smartphone share trends, writes Goldman. Longbow says something similar about Skyworks (SWKS +13.5%) following its FQ1 beat, arguing Samsung exposure (17% of sales) is helping offset Apple exposure (25%). The firm also thinks Skyworks is maintaining power amplifier share, and that sales of other RF chips are offsetting ASP and chip-integration pressures. TQNT +3.3%. AVGO +1.9%. ANAD +1.7%.  (transcripts: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • WHR

    Whirlpool (WHR +2.9%) CEO Jeff Fettig thinks the company's demand in the U.S. will grow by 2% to...

    Whirlpool (WHR +2.9%) CEO Jeff Fettig thinks the company's demand in the U.S. will grow by 2% to 3% this year as the housing market keep up forward momentum. The appliance seller expects slightly better results in Latin America and Asia, forecasting 3% and 5% growth, respectively. (earnings)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • ROAN

    Berry Petroleum (BRY +2.6%) reports production averaged 39.5K boe/day in Q4 and 36.4K boe/day...

    Berry Petroleum (BRY +2.6%) reports production averaged 39.5K boe/day in Q4 and 36.4K boe/day for full-year 2012; expects year-end 2012 reserves of 276M boe. Plans a 2013 capital budget of $500M-$600M, which will continue to be invested in oil assets, and anticipates funding capex from internally generated cash flow. Reaffirms 10%-15% expected growth in 2013 oil production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • CLB

    Core Labs (CLB +8%) is upgraded to Outperform with a $150 target price, up from $110, at...

    Core Labs (CLB +8%) is upgraded to Outperform with a $150 target price, up from $110, at FBR Capital after a "very strong" Q4 and outlook. The firm thinks CLB should benefit from continued beat-and-raise quarters and upward Street earnings revisions in 2013. Given CLB's attractive niche, "investors looking for a pullback before getting more involved in the stock could miss the boat all together."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • ARQL

    Shares of ArQule (ARQL +2.4%) move up after the company says it's enrolled the first patient in...

    Shares of ArQule (ARQL +2.4%) move up after the company says it's enrolled the first patient in its Phase 3 trial of tivantinib, which is being evaluated for the treatment of patients diagnosed with hepatocellular carcinoma who have received one or two prior systemic anti-cancer therapies. The company expects to enroll about 300 patients at approximately 120 clinical centers worldwide.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN -2.4%) and Expedia (EXPE -1.6%) slide after Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt...

    Priceline (PCLN -2.4%) and Expedia (EXPE -1.6%) slide after Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt downgrades Priceline to Equalweight. Devitt sees Priceline posting a bookings CAGR of 19% over the next 3 years (down from 46% over the last 3) and also expects EBITDA margin to fall by 220 bps over this time. Tougher European competition from Expedia, Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) online travel efforts, rising travel search ad costs (good for Google), and a shift to mobile bookings (Priceline is better at monetizing PC activity) are also concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • CBT

    Shares of Cabot (CBT -7.4%) slide today after its FQ1 missed estimates late yesterday. Net...

    Shares of Cabot (CBT -7.4%) slide today after its FQ1 missed estimates late yesterday. Net profit fell 57% Y/Y, as acquisition and restructuring related expenses hit its bottom line and top line sales declined in three of the chemicals company's four segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • BX

    "When private equity works, it really works," says Stephen Schwarzman on the Blackstone (BX...

    "When private equity works, it really works," says Stephen Schwarzman on the Blackstone (BX +7.2%) earnings call. Indeed. Once high-water marks are hit, carried interest goes right to the bottom line ... and they're getting hit. For Q4, RCI in P-E was $45.5M vs. -$28.4M a year ago, in Real Estate, $91.1M vs. $3.5M, in Hedge-fund solutions, $76.3M vs. $4.1M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 6 Comments
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -25.7%) crumbles after posting mixed FQ1 results and (more importantly)...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -25.7%) crumbles after posting mixed FQ1 results and (more importantly) issuing soft guidance. The salvage auction site expects FQ2 EPS of $0.46-$0.50, well below a $0.58 consensus. FY13 EPS is expected to come in at $1.90-$2.02 (below a $2.15 consensus), and FY13 gross merchandise volume is pegged at $1.025B-$1.1B (below prior guidance of $1.1B-$1.2B. LQDT blames macro issues and weaker-than-expected performance from its Liquidation.com and GoIndustry units. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +5%) hit their highest level of the year after the retailer showed...

    AstraZeneca (AZN -3%) would consider $3-4B acquisitions and product deals of $500-$600M, although a large "disruptive" purchase is unlikely, says CEO Pascal Soriot following Q4 earnings. AZN, which is keeping buybacks on hold, won't raise its dividend for the first time in a decade. The firm is in the midst of a patent cliff, having lost exclusivity to Seroquel (schizophrenia) last year, and it's set to lose protection for Nexium (ulcers) and Crestor (cholestoral) in 2014 and 2016 respectively.
